main.docTitle: Specification of Arrangements (Government of the Federal Republic of Germany) (Avoidance of Double Taxation on Shipping Income) Order

section.name: s1
section.heading: Declaration under section 49
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 49 of the Ordinance, it is declared—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: that the arrangements referred to in section 2 have been made with the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany with a view to affording relief from double taxation in relation to income tax and any tax of a similar character imposed by the laws of the Federal Republic; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: that it is expedient that those arrangements should have effect.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Arrangements specified
section.content: The arrangements mentioned in section 1 are in Articles 1 to 6 of the Agreement between the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China and the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany for the Avoidance of Double Taxation with Respect to Taxes on Income and on Capital of Shipping Enterprises, done in duplicate at Hong Kong on 13 January 2003 in the English and German languages as specified in the Schedule and having effect according to the tenor of that Agreement.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Articles 1 to 6 of the Agreement between the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China and the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany for the Avoidance of Double Taxation with respect to Taxes on Income and on Capital of Shipping Enterprises

text.text: (1)This Agreement shall apply to all taxes on income and on capital levied within the area of the Contracting Parties according to their laws irrespective of the manner in which they are levied.

text.text: (3)This Agreement shall also apply to any identical or substantially similar taxes which are imposed by either Contracting Party after the signature of this Agreement in addition to, or in place of, the existing taxes. The competent authorities of the Contracting Parties shall notify each other of any substantial changes which have been made in their respective taxation laws.
(1)For the purposes of this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires:

subparagraph.name: aa
subparagraph.content: in respect of the Federal Republic of Germany, the territory of the Federal Republic of Germany, as well as the area of the sea-bed, its subsoil and the superjacent water column adjacent to the territorial sea, insofar as the Federal Republic of Germany exercises there sovereign rights and jurisdiction in conformity with international law and its national legislation for the purposes of exploring, exploiting, conserving and managing the living and non-living natural resources;

subparagraph.name: bb
subparagraph.content: in respect of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories;

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: aa
bb
subparagraph.content: in the case of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, the Commissioner of Inland Revenue or his authorized representative or any person or body authorized to perform any functions at present exercisable by the Commissioner or similar functions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.def: the term “person” means an individual or a company;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: the term “enterprise of a Contracting Party” means:

subparagraph.name: aa
subparagraph.content: in the case of the Federal Republic of Germany an enterprise carried on by a person who, under German law, is liable to tax therein by reason of his domicile, residence, place of management or any other criterion of a similar nature;

subparagraph.name: bb
subparagraph.content: in the case of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region an enterprise carried on by an individual who is a permanent resident in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region or a company which is managed and controlled in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the term “international traffic” means any transport by a ship operated by an enterprise of a Contracting Party, except when the ship is operated solely between places in the area of the other Contracting Party.

text.text: (2)As regards the application of this Agreement at any time in the area of a Contracting Party, any term not defined therein shall, unless the context otherwise requires, have the meaning that it has at that time under the laws in the area of that Party for the purposes of the taxes to which this Agreement applies, any meaning under the applicable tax laws in the area of that Party prevailing over a meaning given to the term under other laws in the area of that Party.

section.name: s1
section.content: Profits of an enterprise of a Contracting Party from the operation of ships in international traffic shall be taxable only in the area of that Contracting Party.

section.name: s2
section.content: Capital represented by ships operated by an enterprise of a Contracting Party in international traffic and by movable property pertaining to the operation of such ships shall be taxable only in the area of that Contracting Party.

section.name: s3
section.content: Gains from the alienation of ships operated by an enterprise of a Contracting Party in international traffic and from movable property pertaining to the operation of such ships shall be taxable only in the area of that Contracting Party.

section.name: s4
section.content: The provisions of paragraph (1) shall also apply to profits from the participation in a pool, a joint business or an international operating agency.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Article, the term “profits of an enterprise of a Contracting Party from the operation of ships in international traffic” includes:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revenues and gross receipts from the operation of ships for the transport of persons, livestock, goods, mail or merchandise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: profits from the lease of ships on charter fully equipped, manned and supplied or on a bare-boat basis;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: profits from the use or rental of containers (including trailers and ancillary equipment used for transporting the containers);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interest on funds directly connected with that operation.

text.text: The competent authorities of the Contracting Parties shall endeavour to resolve by consultation any difficulties or doubts arising as to the interpretation or application of this Agreement. The competent authorities of the Contracting Parties may communicate with each other directly for the purpose of reaching an agreement.

Each Contracting Party shall notify the other Contracting Party that their respective requirements for the entry into force of this Agreement have been fulfilled. This Agreement shall enter into force on the date on which the last notification is received and shall thereupon have effect:

paragraph.leadIn: in the Federal Republic of Germany:

subparagraph.name: aa
subparagraph.content: in the case of taxes withheld at source, in respect of amounts paid on or after 1 January 1998;

subparagraph.name: bb
subparagraph.content: in the case of other taxes, in respect of taxes levied for periods beginning on or after 1 January 1998;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, for any year of assessment beginning on or after 1 April 1998.

text.text: (1)This Agreement shall remain in force indefinitely but either Contracting Party may terminate the Agreement by giving written notice of termination at least six months before the end of any calendar year. In such event, this Agreement shall cease to have effect:

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the Federal Republic of Germany:

subparagraph.name: aa
bb

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, for any year of assessment beginning on or after the first day of April of the calendar year next following that in which notice is given.

text.text: (2)A written notice of termination given by either Contracting Party shall be deemed to have been given on the date of receipt of such notice by the other Contracting Party.”.
